product_name: NUDESTIXNUDESKIN Citrus Clean Balm & Make-Up Melt
summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsCruelty FreeVeganSustainable PackagingGive BackNUDESKIN NUDESTIX Citrus Clean Balm & Make-Up Melt is a vegan, citrus-infused, aromatherapy cleansing balm that banishes all traces of makeup, freshly cleanses the skin as it brightens and softens with vegan natural extracts in a no mess tube.
details: DetailsBenefitsThis multi-tasking balm quickly melts away makeup and impurities while gently cleansing your skin. Skin feels fresh, soft and supple - and your skin will smell ah-mazing!VeganFeaturesMakeup Remover: Vegan powered emollients gently melt off all traces of makeupMakeup Remover: Sulfate free gentle Olive Oil based cleanserMakeup Remover: Rose Hip Fruit Oil - Rich in Vitamin A, fights against aging by boosting moisture and collagenSkin Cleanser: Contains sulfate-free gentle Olive Oil based cleansers and Pore-cleansing oils to deep clean skinSkin Cleanser: Litsea Cubeba Fruit Oil (May Chang Oil) - Citrus essential oil to help detox pores, balance sebum, rejuvenate skin and refresh mindSkin Cleanser: Orange Peel Oil - Natural antiseptic and anti-inflammatorySkin Cleanser: Rosemary Leaf Oil - Natural antibacterial and detox for congested poresSkin Cleanser: Eucalyptus Leaf Oil - Skin purifying, cleansing, clarifyingSkin Softener: Vegan powered essential oils soften skin and calm the mindSkin Softener: Savia Hispanica (Chia) Seed Oil - absorbs 6x moisturizer to hydrate skinSkin Softener: Lavender Oil - Natural Skin CalmingSkin Softener: Neroli Oil (Bitter Orange Flower) - Aromatherapy to reduce stress and clears mindSkin Brightener: Natural AHAs gently exfoliate and brighten skinSkin Brightener: Apple Fruit Extract - Powerful antioxidant to protect skin from free-radical damage and natural malic acid (AHA) to gently exfoliate to brighten skinFormulated WithoutSulfatesPhthalatesParabensGlutenSynthetic fragrancesItem 2571976How To UseUse daily, morning and night.Massage onto dry skin until skin feels clean and makeup is melted off.Rinse off with warm water or wipe with a dry cloth if no water available.Follow with Nudeskin 5% Citrus Fruit and Glycolic Glow Toner and Nudeskin Citrus-C Mask and Daily Moisturizer.IngredientsIsodecyl Neopentanoate, Isononyl Isononanoate, PEG-10 Isostearate, PEG-20 Glyceryl Triisostearate, Silica Dimethyl Silylate, Synthetic Wax, Trihydroxystearin, Sorbitan Olivate, Litsea Cubeba Fruit Oil, Citrus Aurantium Dulcis (Orange) Peel Oil, Lavandula Angustifolia (Lavender) Oil, Pelargonium Graveolens Oil, Dehydroacetic Acid, Canarium Luzonicum Gum Nonvolatiles, Rosmarinus Officinalis (Rosemary) Leaf Oil, Eucalyptus Globulus Leaf Oil, Anthemis Nobilis Flower Oil, Citrus Aurantium Amara (Bitter Orange) Flower Oil, Acacia Senegal Gum, Curcuma Longa (Turmeric) Root Extract, Maltodextrin, Water (Aqua), Rosa Canina Fruit Oil, Butylene Glycol, Salvia Hispanica Seed Extract, Pyrus Malus (Apple) Fruit Extract, Citral*, Limonene*, Linalool*, Citronellol*, Geraniol*.*Naturally occurring in essential oils listed.Nudestix formulations are updated from time to time as part of our commitment to innovation and maintaining global compliance. Therefore, ingredient lists or claims shown here may differ from the box of the product depending on time and global region of purchase.Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: Use daily, morning and night.Massage onto dry skin until skin feels clean and makeup is melted off.Rinse off with warm water or wipe with a dry cloth if no water available.Follow with Nudeskin 5% Citrus Fruit and Glycolic Glow Toner and Nudeskin Citrus-C Mask and Daily Moisturizer.

reviews.headline: The smell
reviews.comments: The smell is incredibly overpowering and burns my eyes. It does take off all makeup even full glam but there are cheaper and better cleansing balms out there that don't burn.

reviews.headline: Good Product
reviews.comments: I got this a few months ago, i was looking for a makeup melting balm and this product did its job.. i wouldnt buy again tho just bc it did burn my eyes, i have tried other melting balms that dont do it but i wanted to try this one. The smell is good and refreshing on the skin but even after rinsing off it leave face a bit greasy which i dont particularly like the feeling.

reviews.headline: Melts Make-up off
reviews.comments: I love this product! smells great, goes on like a dream, moisturizing and leaves a clean finish. worth the $

reviews.headline: love but not the fragrance
reviews.comments: This product is absolutely wonderful for rmoving stubborn makeup. my waterproof mascara has nothjng on it. but the fragrance is just so strong that it hurts my eyes. i keep coming back to because i cant find anythjng else better

reviews.headline: 100% will buy again
reviews.comments: Removes makeup completely & leaves skin super fresh & soft.

reviews.headline: Happy costumer
reviews.comments: I purchased this product back in December and never used it. Today I wanted to try it and I loved it. It removed my make up instantly and made my face feel so soft. Oh, and it smells great! :)

reviews.headline: The BEST cleanser/ makeup remover ever!
reviews.comments: Feels like butter, dissolves all makeup and leaves skin feeling super clean and still hydrated. I love that it's such an effective cleanser but still leaves your skin feeling soft & fresh but not dry. 100% will buy again.

reviews.headline: Really Lovely!
reviews.comments: This is a really nice balm based cleanser. I love that you can use it with warm water for a squeaky clean feel, or just wipe it away for a bit more of a moisturizing finish. The smell is really nice, it's super fresh and clean. The only drawback for me is that it can be a bit stinging if it gets in your eyes because of the citrus which, since it's a makeup remover it probably will. Not the biggest deal if you're careful but something to be aware of.

reviews.headline: Works
reviews.comments: I don't like the strong citrus smell and stings my eyes. But, it works well.

reviews.headline: Going back to Banila
reviews.comments: As far as cleansing balms go, I usually use Daily Greens by Farmacy or Banila at night to wash my face and remove my makeup. I bought this because it was on sale and I'm sadly disappointed. It doesn't remove my mascara that well (even after using Clinique eye makeup remover first) and the formula stings my eyes a bit. I will definitely be going back to Banila after this.

reviews.headline: Love, love, love
reviews.comments: I have never used a cleanser like this before and I am obsessed! Smells lovely and my skin loves it too. Feels clean without being stripped and is so smooth. A new staple for me that I will absolutely be purchasing again!

reviews.headline: My New Staple Evening Cleanser
reviews.comments: I'm 48 & blessed to have clear & even toned skin for the most part. But as I've aged, my skin has gotten drier & the makeup removers & cleansers I was used to using became to harsh/drying. I've been using Elemis Cleansing Balm for quite a while now & love it; but it's pricey & the jar just isn't convenient for me. I've been using Nudestix makeup for ~2 years now & absolutely love it so I decided to give their skin care line a try...so glad I did! This balm is wonderful! Smells amazing (1 of the reasons I loved Elemis over the Clinique Cleansing Balm), doesn't irritate my skin, didn't cause any breakouts....my makeup - including eye makeup - was easily removed. My skin feels soft & clean. LOVE the tube! So much better than a big jar. Also love that I can buy this in a travel sized kit.

reviews.headline: Not a fan
reviews.comments: I wanted to like this but honestly don't think it takes off my makeup that well and definitely irritates my eyes unlike the Clinique cleansing balm. Little tube is not worth the price either. Smells good so I gave it 2 stars.

media.headline: Love This Balm

faceoff_positive.comments: As someone who loves to wear a full glam face of makeup, I have to have really good cleansers. It is important to me to ensure that every bit of makeup is taken off at the end of the night so I'm always on the hunt for new cleansing products to keep in my arsenal. This 4 in 1 by NudeStix did not disappoint! First off, I love the packaging. The pink is super cute and aestheically pleasing. Plus, I prefer tubes compared to little jars that I always lose the spoon for and end up scooping up with my fingers, which is so unsanitary. So, the packaging matters (Plus the box it comes in is biodegradable! Stuff like that totally aligns with my values). Next thing I really enjoy is the smell. I actually love scents in skincare and this one is just lovely. That combined with the balms silky texture makes for a big win. The best thing about this product is that it is 4 things in 1. I love a product that can multitask. And it comes through on each of those 4 claims. It effectively removes makeup, it cleanses the skin beautifully, my skin felt noticably softer and I could see the little extra brightness with regular use. Also, what was really nice is that a little product went a nice long way and it was so easy and quick to use. My preferred way to use it as a first step in a double cleanse as that is just my routine when it comes to cleaning my face. And it is completely the perfect product to use for that. It is 100% comparable to other products on the market and I think slightly cheaper then some of the more popular brands. My sole negative to this cleanser is that it did slightly irriate my eyes sometimes. I think that may have to do with the citrus extracts but as long as I was careful, it didn't happen. Besides that, this is definitely on my new favourite cleansing balms and I will definitely be purchasing a tube when mine runs out
faceoff_positive.headline: My new favourite cleansing balm!

faceoff_negative.comments:
This product was alright, generally, but at the end of the day, it felt like a barrier to my serum routine, and burned my eyes when I tried to wash it off. 

Packaging: The product itself is packaged in a tube that holds its form well. It was easy to squeeze and held its shape, but I worried that when the tube got to the bottom, it might crack and leak. This tube is packaged in a clear plastic case that appears to only serve the purpose in telling that the clear plastic case was biodegradable. 

The Product: Yellow in colour with a soft wax texture. It smells kind of chemically lemon, like cleaning product. 

Application: Went on smooth and actually dissolved the makeup! Even the waterproof liner and mascara. I was actually impressed. It did its job. 

After: The instructions said you could leave it as is after rubbing it in or washing it off with warm water. Considering I have a serum routine, I decided to wash and continue with my daily regimen. This was a problem. When I washed it off with warm water, it made the skin around my eyes burn and go red. It was completely fine if I didn't add water (and the following night, I just left it on, and while it didn't burn my eyes, it did feel greasy and I didn't like that). Adding serums on top of this thick, waxy layer seemed like a waste of money. 

Final thoughts: Would this be good for my daily wash? No. I don't think so. It feels like it creates a barrier to the additional products. When it would be good is when I'm traveling, as it would be less likely to leak in my bag than other cleansers. If I'm flying out for a few days, and didn't want to take my whole routine, this would be a nice option for a few days.
faceoff_negative.headline: Decent for on the go, but not as part of a regimen
